ac_configuration.title: AC Temperature Limits (Step 3.5 of 6) - Optional
ac_configuration.description:
**Configure AC temperature limits for {room_name}** (optional - only if your AC reports incorrect values).

**Your AC reports:**
â€¢ Minimum: {reported_min}Â°C
â€¢ Maximum: {reported_max}Â°C

**âš ï¸ Only configure if these are INCORRECT!**

**Example problems:**
â€¢ AC reports 7Â°C minimum but physically can't go below 18Â°C
â€¢ AC reports 35Â°C maximum but physically can't go above 30Â°C

**Leave at 0 (default):**
Use the values reported by your AC integration (recommended for most users)

**Set to actual values:**
Override with your AC's real physical limits to prevent impossible temperature settings during aggressive cooling/heating.

**Why this matters:**
Dynamic targeting may try to set your AC to impossible temperatures (e.g., 12Â°C when minimum is 18Â°C), which wastes energy and prevents proper operation.

**Presence Devices (Optional):**

temperature.title: Temperature Preferences (Step 6 of 6)

**Just 2 simple questions!** ğŸŒ¡ï¸ The wizard automatically calculates ALL temperature thresholds for **{room_name}**.

**Choose your comfort style:**
â€¢ **Tight** (Â±0.5Â°C): Precise control, 20+ AC cycles/day
â€¢ **Balanced** (Â±1.0Â°C): â­ Recommended, 10-15 cycles/day
â€¢ **Relaxed** (Â±1.5Â°C): Energy saving, 5-10 cycles/day

**Example:** 23Â°C Â± 1.0Â°C means:
â€¢ Comfort zone: 22.0Â°C - 24.0Â°C (AC off)
â€¢ Gentle cooling starts: 24.1Â°C
â€¢ Medium cooling starts: 25.0Â°C
â€¢ Max cooling starts: 26.0Â°C
â€¢ *(Heating thresholds calculated similarly)*

**What happens next:**
âœ… All 6 temperature tiers calculated automatically

advanced_escalation.title: ğŸš¨ Advanced Escalation (Step 5.6 of 6) - Optional Feature
advanced_escalation.description:
**NEW FEATURE: Incremental Wrong-Direction Escalation** âœ¨

**What it does:**
Automatically adds escalation levels when temperature moves the **WRONG way** - rising during cooling or falling during heating.

**Perfect for:**
â€¢ ğŸ® Gaming rooms (PCs generating variable heat)
â€¢ ğŸ³ Kitchen areas (cooking heat spikes)
â€¢ â˜€ï¸ Rooms with sun exposure
â€¢ ğŸ‘¥ High-occupancy rooms (variable people count)

**How it works (Incremental Per-Check System):**
```
Time 0: AC starts â†’ Fan 1 (Base Level 0)
Time 2: Temp rising â†’ Fan 2 (Level 0 + 1 for wrong direction)
Time 4: Still rising â†’ Fan 3 (Level 0 + 2 for wrong direction)
Time 6: Still rising â†’ Fan 4 (Level 0 + 3 for wrong direction)
Time 8: Still rising â†’ Fan 5 (Level 0 + 4, capped at maximum)
```

**Key advantages:**
â€¢ âœ… Responds at EVERY effectiveness check (e.g., every 2 minutes)
â€¢ âœ… Smooth gradual escalation instead of sudden jumps
â€¢ âœ… Self-correcting (stops when temp stabilizes)
â€¢ âœ… Simpler to configure (just 2 settings!)

**Safe by default:**
â€¢ âŒ **Disabled** by default (won't affect your automation)
â€¢ âœ… **Enable only if** you have variable heat loads
â€¢ ğŸ¯ Starts responding at first effectiveness check (no delays)

**Settings explanation:**
â€¢ **Enable:** Turn feature ON/OFF
â€¢ **Escalation Per Check:** How many levels to add each check (+1 recommended)

ğŸ’¡ **Recommendation for gaming rooms:** Enable with +1 per check for smooth, responsive escalation!

data.enable_wrong_direction_escalation: ğŸš¨ Enable Incremental Wrong-Direction Escalation â€¢ Smooth power ramp-up
data.wrong_direction_escalation_per_check: âš¡ Escalation Per Check â€¢ +Levels to add each check (0-2)

compressor_protection.title: ğŸ›¡ï¸ Compressor Protection (Step 5.8 of 6)
compressor_protection.description:
**Protect your A/C compressor from rapid cycling damage** for **{room_name}**.

**Why this matters:**
â€¢ ğŸ”§ AC compressors need 3-5 minutes for refrigerant pressure to equalize
â€¢ âš¡ Rapid on/off cycling causes mechanical stress and shortens lifespan
â€¢ ğŸ’° Modern units (2015+) often have built-in 3-5 min delay timers

**Minimum Runtime:**
â€¢ How long AC must RUN before changing cooling/heating intensity
â€¢ Example: 15 min = prevents rapid tier switching
â€¢ **Recommended:** 15 minutes for standard units

**Minimum Off-Time:**
â€¢ How long AC must be OFF before restarting
â€¢ Example: 10 min = protects compressor from rapid restarts
â€¢ **Recommended:** 10 minutes (or 3 minutes if AC has built-in protection)

**Enforce Off-Time Protection:**
â€¢ âœ… **ON (Recommended):** Blueprint enforces minimum off-time delay
â€¢ âŒ **OFF:** Allows immediate restart (use if AC has hardware protection)

**When to disable enforcement:**
â€¢ Your AC is modern (2015+) with built-in delay timer
â€¢ You want to rely on AC hardware protection only
â€¢ Testing/debugging automation behavior
